args: I will now lay out the path for the\nSparrows moving forward.
First, we shall join up with His Highness\nPrince {player_name}.
Then, using the Halidom as our base of\noperation, we will free the capital from\nthe scourge of the Dyrenell invaders.
Captain! At last, the time has come!
Vice Captain of the White Sparrows\nPatia
Let's show those Dyrenell dogs\nwhat true Alberians are made of!
Hear hear, Captain! We'll put some fear\ninto those imperial blackguards!
I've long awaited the day when we could\nmake right the humiliations we've been\nforced to weather all this time!
While I appreciate your enthusiasm,\nI must make certain you all are aware\nof a certain fact.
The path we walk dictates that we raise\nour swords against the royal family.
If any among you feel you cannot do this\nthing, I would bid you leave our order now.
I mean precisely what I said: Our course\nputs us on a path to battle the royal family.
I suppose I never thought of it\nin quite that way before...
Thus far, we have bent to the will\nof the Empire.
We did so in order to help the young royal\nwho will become the next monarch,\nand take back our kingdom in so doing.
Yet it is an undeniable fact that some of\nthe royals have sided WITH the Empire.

We White Sparrows serve the royal family,
but above all we serve Alberia. And if that
means we need raise our blades against
the monarchy in her defense, we shall.
To lay a hand upon the royals one ought\nto serve is the greatest act of disloyalty\na knight can commit.
And as such a treasonous individual,\nyou may even face condemnation\nat the hands of your own kin.

Thus, I will cast no aspersions whatsoever
upon any who choose to leave us this day.
Think carefully, and make the decision
that best serves your own life.
I steeled my resolve the moment I\nfollowed you and joined the Sparrows.
The White Sparrow Corps can accept no\nrestrictions or leash, even if it means\nopposing king and country!
If our nation is rotting from within,\nit is the duty of the Sparrows to carve\nthat rot out and expose it to the sun.
I know well we speak of treason this day,\nyet I also see the reason for it—and I will\nnot permit you to shoulder that sin alone.
Aye, Patia's right! I'm with you\ntill the bitter end, Captain!
And I! My pride and honor belong\never to the White Sparrows!
Are you all certain? Think carefully now.
This is a question not only of your own\nfutures, but those around you. Friends.\nPerhaps even family.
Our families would let us have it if we\nturned our backs on our duty! They're\nwith us to the end—as we are with you!
Seconded, Captain! All that I am,\nI offer now to the White Sparrows!
It seems we all share your resolve,\nCaptain Leif.
And that's because whatever the future\nmay hold, it is our greatest honor to\nfight at your side to the very end.
My apologies, all of you. It seems I\nmisjudged the strength of your resolve.
Your point is well made—there's not a\nsoul within the White Sparrows whose\nwill has not been honed to steel.
Now let us lay low the Empire as one!
Well, this isn't good.\nI think we're surrounded.
Fear not. Your Highness.\nI shall see you safe—I swear it!
We have them vastly outnumbered.\nDon't let this opportunity slip away!\nSee to it the prince is taken alive!
Are you crazy? That thing will take out\nyour own side as easily as it does ours!
Are you all right, Your Highness?
White Sparrows, defensive formation!\nProtect the prince at all costs!
So it's true! The White Sparrows have\nturned traitor to the glorious Empire!
The White Sparrows serve the Kingdom\nof Alberia, and I name as foe any who\nwould seek to do her harm.
Patia, take your troops and\nharry the enemy!
The rest of you, stay with the prince!
...Captain, I've confirmed that the\nimperial army is in full retreat.
Ha! The Empire is no match for us!
Thank you, Captain. They caught us\nwhen I was the only escort guarding\nHis Highness.
It is most shameful that I allowed him\nto be exposed to such danger.
Untrue. Without your quick actions,\nwe could not have saved the prince.\nYou have my gratitude.
If anyone is doing thanking around here,\nit should be me.
But Leif, are you sure it was a good idea\nto openly declare war on the Empire?
Weren't you hiding in the capital\nin order to protect Zethia?
From the moment I left the capital,\nI bound us to this fate.
Further, we were already headed to your\ncastle, so I would ask you not to worry\nyourself about it overmuch.
Wait. You were heading to the Halidom?
We were indeed. From this day hence, \nYour Highness, the White Sparrows\nshall serve as your blade and shield!
You have no idea how happy I am\nto hear that, Leif. Thank you.
